revised_title: Awards and Achievements in Science: Royal Society Anniversary Meeting 1954
tldr: The President of the Royal Society, Dr. E. D. Adrian, presents the awards and achievements of several distinguished scientists at the Anniversary Meeting in 1954. The recipients include Sir Edmund Whittaker for his contributions to mathematics, Dr. C. R. Burch for his advancements in high-vacuum engineering, Sir John Cockcroft for his work in nuclear physics, Professor H. A. Krebs for his research on intermediary metabolism, Dr. J. W. Cook for his studies on polycyclic aromatic compounds, and Dr. E. B. Ford for his work on genetics and natural populations.
